title: Stories of the Border Marches
author: Lang, John
snippet: At Burnmouth, at Berwick(though no boat belonging to Berwick that day was out), at Goswick Bay,and elsewhere, boat after boat, driven before the fury of the gale, wasforced over by wind and sea, and sunk with all her crew, or was dashedto pieces on the shore.
